block.p: Anne Van Campen Decker, the daughter of Marianne Decker and Francis K. Decker Jr. of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Steven Paul Toomey, the son of Shirley and Paul Toomey of Bolton, Conn. The Rev. William Findlay, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at Quogue Chapel in Quogue, N.Y.
The couple, both 24, graduated from Bates College and are account managers at Innovative Internet Marketing Solutions, a Web site developer in Wallingford, Conn.

Anne Van Campen Decker, the daughter of Marianne Decker and Francis K. Decker Jr. of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Steven Paul Toomey, the son of Shirley and Paul Toomey of Bolton, Conn. The Rev. William Findlay, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at Quogue Chapel in Quogue, N.Y.
The couple, both 24, graduated from Bates College and are account managers at Innovative Internet Marketing Solutions, a Web site developer in Wallingford, Conn.

Ms. Decker is keeping her name. Her father is a partner at the Manhattan office of the law firm of Latham & Watkins. Her mother is the organist and choir director at St. Philip's Episcopal Church in Manhattan.
The bridegroom's father is a deliverer, based in Suffield, Conn., for Praxair, a manufacturer of industrial gases.
